GapFillInput.Title: can, can't, have to, don't have to
GapFillInput.Instruction: Choose the correct form of have to or can with the verb in brackets. Type your answer in each gap.

Content.Question:
Anita: What time do I have to start (I / start)?
Liz: The shop opens at nine o'clock but you have to be (you / be) here at 8.45 every day.
Anita: And do I have to wear (I / wear) a uniform?
Liz: No, you don't but you have to wear (wear) smart clothes.
Anita: Where can I have (I / have) lunch?
Liz: You can eat (You / eat) in our cafeteria or you can bring (you / bring)
your own food and eat in the staff room. Remember, you can't eat (you / eat)
anything when you are working.
Anita: I'm worried because I don't know the names of all the perfumes.
Liz: You don't have to know (You / know) everything about the perfumes when you start. You can ask (You / ask) me for help.
Anita: Can we get (we / get) any free perfume?
Liz: We can't get (We / get) free perfume but we don't have to pay (we / pay) the
full price. Only 75% of the price.

P.FONT: Anita is going to start a new job as a shop assistant in the perfume department of a big store.
